message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CV 

The paper proposes a Bayesian framework for graph convolutional neural networks (GCNN) and focuses on improving the capability of incorporating uncertainty in the underlying graph structure. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also utilizes node features and training labels in the posterior inference of graphs, which relates to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI) and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on benchmark node classification tasks, which falls under computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CV).
